image.altText: Close up shot of arms holding a small child, whose bare leg and foot are visible.

props.synopsis: The government has announced a $42.3 million package to publicly fund fertility treatment for Queenslanders who have experienced serious illness.

title.children: Cancer affected patients entitled to subsidised IVF under new Queensland scheme

image.altText: Victoria wears scrubs decorated with pictures of whales and other sea life, while sitting outside a hospital.

props.synopsis: Students share their experiences of "placement poverty", which is when mandatory, unpaid placements push them into financial stress and sometimes out of their studies.

title.children: Doing 1,000 hours of unpaid work to graduate is the reality of 'placement poverty' — and it's taking a toll on students

image.altText: Jodie Belyea and Richard Marles celebrating in a group of people wearing red.

props.synopsis: Jodie Belyea claims victory in by-election in the federal seat of Dunkley in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Labor primary vote holds strong in by-election in Melbourne seat of Dunkley, with Jodie Belyea claiming victory

image.altText: A woman with a rainbow flag sat on a motorbike

props.synopsis: They came dressed head to toe in glitter, rainbows, mesh and feathers, but as thousands of people partied at the 46th Sydney Mardi Gras parade, two men were firmly in everyone's mind.

title.children: Protesters can't halt Sydney Mardi Gras as thousands turn out to celebrate

image.altText: Rossy Smith smiling next to two children.

props.synopsis: Despite homophobia, cultural taboos and misinformation, when beloved gay uncle Rossy Smith died of AIDS, it changed First Nations health forever.

title.children: ‘They said we couldn’t name a football tournament after a gay, Black man with AIDS'. It was one of the most successful events ever

image.altText: Carla snorkel

props.synopsis: A Victorian couple thought never "in a million years" would they again see their mobile phone lost overboard on a Valentine's Day getaway to the Great Barrier Reef.

title.children: Carla found a phone on the ocean floor while scuba diving. When she turned it on, a message appeared

image.altText: woman holding a ball with her dog

props.synopsis: Leasing a fenced backyard for puppy play dates is the latest side hustle in the suburbs but prospective hosts are warned the extra income comes with risks.

title.children: Home owners are renting out their backyards — to dogs — for extra cash

image.altText: A crowd of people standing with flags.

props.synopsis: Labor's Julian Hill warns Cambodia's rulers not to intimidate its critics in Australia, while protesters from several South-East Asian communities are demanding the Albanese government take a stronger stance on human rights abuses during the ASEAN-Australia summit in Melbourne next week.

title.children: Federal MP warns Cambodia's rulers not to intimidate critics ahead of ASEAN-Australia summit

image.altText: Kane Williamson looks down and Travis Head celebrates

props.synopsis: New Zealand fights hard with the bat to give itself an outside chance of an historic victory at Basin Reserve, but Australia remains in the box seat after day three of the first Test.

title.children: New Zealand battles to remain outside chance of historic win, but Australia still in charge of first Test

image.altText: Several medicine packs stacked on top of one another

props.synopsis: The drug Ryeqo is approved by the TGA to treat endometriosis. Here's what we know about what it does and how much it costs.

title.children: TGA approves new drug for endometriosis treatment, a first in 13 years

image.altText: A ute bogged in mud.

props.synopsis: Three men, including a middle-aged man with medical conditions, are rescued by helicopter after three days lost in the outback Queensland bush without food or water.

title.children: Men who got bogged in outback rescued after three days with no food or water

image.altText: A woman with died red hair looks out off her balcony with a sombre look.

props.synopsis: Sepsis is the leading cause of preventable deaths in Queensland children, a study has found, occurring at higher rates than youth suicide, road accidents and drownings.

title.children: Four years ago Jenni sang to her son as he died of one of Queensland's more preventable illnesses

image.altText: Hannah Green tees off during third round of LPGA Tour's Women's World Championship.

props.synopsis: Australian Hannah Green is in second place, two shots behind Japanese leader Ayaka Furue, after the third round of the LPGA Tour's Women's World Championship.

title.children: Aussie Green in the mix at LPGA Tour's Women's World Championship

image.altText: Alex de Minaur plays a double-fisted backhand in his semifinal against Jack Draper in Acalpulco.

props.synopsis: World number nine Alex de Minaur advances to the final of the ATP 500 tournament in Acapulco after his opponent Jack Draper retires in the third set of their last-four clash.

title.children: Defending champ de Minaur through to Acapulco final

image.altText: Photo illustration of Luke Davies and Jesse Baird and flowers at the scene where police allege they were killed around sides

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people will gather on Sydney's Oxford Street for this year's Mardi Gras, but for many in the queer community this year's festivities will not feel the same.

title.children: One of the most joyous days on Sydney's calendar is being overshadowed this year

image.altText: A woman and her three children smile at the camera.

props.synopsis: Cancer awareness advocate Terri Grosser is being celebrated as a local hero and a "special" soul who died too young.

title.children: Outback mum's dying wish to all Australians after aggressive cancer takes hold

image.altText: A close up image of Jennifer Lopez on a red carpet.

props.synopsis: Celebrities such as Kourtney Kardashian, Beyonce, Gwyneth Paltrow and Jennifer Lopez all extol the virtues of swigging extra virgin as well as slathering it on their skin, crediting olive oil for their glowing complexions.

title.children: Will drinking straight olive oil or moisturising with it actually help your skin?

image.altText: Portrait of a man aboard a boat, sunny weather

props.synopsis: The sparkling waters hold many untold stories; from the saltwater custodians who've cared for this place for thousands of years to the fishermen and boatbuilders whose livelihoods depend on it.

title.children: Beyond the Opera House and the bridge, Sydney Harbour holds many secrets

image.altText: An elderly woman in large, dark framed glasses and a man in a suit

props.synopsis: The designer and textile expert known for her eccentric style is being remembered as a fashion icon.

title.children: Fashion celebrity Iris Apfel has died aged 102

image.altText: A woman holds a portrait of Alexei Navalny and a book titled "A saint against the Reich"

props.synopsis: A large crowd of mourners at the funeral of opposition leader Alexei Navalny defies government warnings by engaging in a rare public anti-Kremlin demonstration in Moscow.

title.children: 'Putin is a murderer': Australia's ambassador among mourners as Navalny's funeral becomes rare protest

image.altText: man in a wheelchair in front of cattle

props.synopsis: Kangaroo Island farmer Steven Childs, who has quadriplegia, is a tough businessman who likes to take risks. In his latest project, the entrepreneur is spending millions to turn his bushfire-ravaged pine forest into productive farm land.

title.children: Farmer takes on ambitious bushfire-recovery project after life-changing accident

image.altText: Peter Dutton wearing a suit sits at the desk in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: With a by-election in Dunkley this weekend, you would think the cost of living would be the major focus of the Coalition's political attack on the government. Or even that it might just be out there talking about it a bit, writes Laura Tingle.

title.children: There's only one issue that matters to voters right now and the Coalition won't talk about it

image.altText: Shark-infested waters

props.synopsis: "Hundreds and hundreds" of sharks bite their way into a trawler's prawn catch with the competition so fierce, fishers want to "give up".

title.children: Epic feeding frenzy caught on camera as sharks maul trawler catch

image.altText: A teenaged boy wears a jumper saying Bring Them Home Now while leaning against a door.

props.synopsis: As negotiations to secure a temporary ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas stumble, a teenager who spent 54 days in captivity is pleading for the remaining hostages to be released.

title.children: When Hamas arrived in Israel, Ofir was taken captive. He can still remember when he crossed into Gaza

image.altText: An Australian athlete smiles as she stands with her arms wide holding an Australian flag behind her.

props.synopsis: Australian Nicola Olyslagers soars to high jump gold at the world indoor athletics championships in Glasgow for her first global title.

title.children: Aussie Olyslagers leaps to glory as world indoor high jump champ

image.altText: Groups of people laugh as they stand in round barrels on a street, crushing grapes.

props.synopsis: Festivals are drawing crowds of visitors to regional Queensland each year, boosting the state's economy by $850 million, and there are plans to grow that even further.

title.children: From outback camel races to DIY grape crushing, quirky events are pulling travellers to regional Queensland

image.altText: The Facebook app is shown in the app store on a smart phone

props.synopsis: A battle is brewing between the government and Meta after the tech giant announced it would no longer pay Australian news publishers for content that appears on its platform. This is what it could mean for your Facebook and Instagram feeds.

title.children: Do you post and read news on Facebook and Instagram? Get ready for a 'troubling' change to your feeds

image.altText: A destroyed shop front

props.synopsis: Police say the two boys and two girls are linked to arson attacks in Mill Park and Ballarat, and a vehicle theft in Wonga Park.

title.children: Four Melbourne teenagers arrested over string of burglaries and arson attacks

image.altText: A zoomed in photo of a semi-trailer truck and a rescue worker on a line dangling over the side of a large bridge.

props.synopsis: Rescuers are praised as "serious heroes" after saving a driver left high above a river following a three-vehicle crash in the US.

title.children: Video captures truck driver's lucky escape, rescued as their vehicle dangles off a bridge

image.altText: A composite of two images: One of Elon Musk in a suit speaking to a microphone, and one of Sam Altman speaking to a microphone

props.synopsis: Mr Musk, who is one of the world's wealthiest people, says the AI firm he helped create is putting money ahead of benefiting humanity.

title.children: Elon Musk sues ChatGPT maker OpenAI for allegedly 'perverting' itself for profit

image.altText: A man and woman dressed in red, traditional Indian wear

props.synopsis: Billionaire Mukesh Ambani is kickstarting big fat Indian wedding celebrations for his son Anant Ambani, 28, who is set to marry his longtime girlfriend Radhika Merchant.

title.children: India's richest man brings Rihanna, Mark Zuckerberg and more to a pre-wedding bash for his son

image.altText: An illustration of a persons head with a small pink creature inside representing the amygdala

props.synopsis: Most people have heard of premenstrual syndrome or PMS, but not many have heard of the much more severe premenstrual dysphoric disorder — which can make sufferers extremely unwell and struggle to function.

title.children: Emma had to 'fake' feeling normal because of a condition that many don't know exists

image.altText: Two baby elephants walk between their mother's legs

props.synopsis: A study conducted between 2022 and 2023 finds elephants travel a great distance to bury their young with care.

title.children: Asian Elephants mourn and bury their babies, Indian study finds
